Class InputHandler

java.lang.Object
presentation.InputHandler
public class InputHandler extends Object
Utility for reading and validating console input in the CLI application.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    InputHandler()
    Creates a new InputHandler.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    double
    readDouble(String message)
    Reads a valid double from the user, reprompting on invalid input.

    Reads a valid integer from the user, reprompting on invalid input.

    Reads an integer within the specified range, inclusive.

    Reads an optional string input, which may be empty.

  • Constructor Details

    • InputHandler

      public InputHandler()
      Creates a new InputHandler.

  • Method Details

    • readString

      public String readString(String message)
      Reads a non-empty string from the user, reprompting on empty input.
      Parameters:
      message - the prompt to show before reading input
      Returns:
      the trimmed, non-empty string entered by the user

    • readInt

      public int readInt(String message)
      Reads a valid integer from the user, reprompting on invalid input.
      Parameters:
      message - the prompt to show
      Returns:
      the parsed integer value

    • readIntRange

      public int readIntRange(String message, int min, int max)
      Reads an integer within the specified range, inclusive. Reprompts until a value within [min, max] is entered.
      Parameters:
      message - the prompt to show
      min - the minimum accepted value
      max - the maximum accepted value
      Returns:
      the integer within the requested range

    • readYesNo

      public boolean readYesNo(String message)
      Reads a yes/no input from the user. Accepts 'Y' or 'N' (case-insensitive).
      Parameters:
      message - the prompt message (Y/N is appended automatically)
      Returns:
      true for 'Y', false for 'N'

    • readDouble

      public double readDouble(String message)
      Reads a valid double from the user, reprompting on invalid input.
      Parameters:
      message - the prompt to show
      Returns:
      the parsed double value

    • readOptionalString

      public String readOptionalString(String message)
      Reads an optional string input, which may be empty. Returns null if the trimmed input is empty.
      Parameters:
      message - the prompt to show
      Returns:
      the trimmed input string or null if empty
